transcript:
you know that there are times in your
life where you actually do a really good
job and then you ask yourself why can't
I be like this every day right there's
one day that you're super focused you
get everything done on time you wake up
in the morning you study for three hours
you do all your work for the day and
then you're free for the rest of the day
it feels liberating feels so good and
then the next day you stumble you get
distracted and then you ask yourself
okay how do I stop this distraction how
do I fix that problem and what positive
deviants essentially does it doesn't
focus on the problems it focuses on the
solutions so what positive deviance is
all about is take that one day that you
did do a good job and ask yourself what
are the factors that lead to this
success instead of focusing on all the
stuff that knocks you off your game try
to duplicate that which puts you on your
game and so as you look at the success
that you have let's say you exercise one
morning look at when did you go to bed
the night before what did you eat the
day before what was on your mind were
you stressed out did you play video
games and look at all of the factors
that led to that success
